comments.body: Do we need the bump here or is this unrelated? Happy to include it either way, I’d just like to understand it.

Yes, the `rules_nixpkgs` update includes a change to the nixpkgs platform constraints. That requires an update to `rules_haskell` as well. See https://github.com/tweag/rules_nixpkgs/pull/122 and https://github.com/tweag/rules_haskell/pull/1313/files#diff-3180f021208ca49e05f50da55d00dd65R15
Maybe add those to `exclude` in `glob` above instead?

comments.body:
If this patch is no longer required, can we remove it?


<details>
<summary>If it is still needed, the following applies to 1.1.0</summary>

``` patch
diff --git a/internal/pkg_npm/pkg_npm.bzl b/internal/pkg_npm/pkg_npm.bzl
index be857b3f..410a90b8 100644
--- a/internal/pkg_npm/pkg_npm.bzl
+++ b/internal/pkg_npm/pkg_npm.bzl
@@ -202,6 +202,7 @@ def create_package(ctx, deps_sources, nested_packages):
     if stamp:
         inputs.append(ctx.version_file)
 
+    posix = ctx.toolchains["@rules_sh//sh/posix:toolchain_type"]
     ctx.actions.run(
         progress_message = "Assembling npm package %s" % package_dir.short_path,
         mnemonic = "AssembleNpmPackage",
@@ -209,6 +210,9 @@ def create_package(ctx, deps_sources, nested_packages):
         inputs = inputs,
         outputs = [package_dir, ctx.outputs.pack, ctx.outputs.publish],
         arguments = [args],
+        env = {
+            "PATH": ctx.host_configuration.host_path_separator.join(posix.paths),
+        },
     )
     return package_dir
 
@@ -246,4 +250,5 @@ pkg_npm = rule(
     attrs = PKG_NPM_ATTRS,
     doc = _DOC,
     outputs = PKG_NPM_OUTPUTS,
+    toolchains = ["@rules_sh//sh/posix:toolchain_type"],
 )
```

</details>

comments.body:
This upgrade is not strictly necessary; I was trying to build `grpc-health-probe` from source and I was getting errors because the versions of `bazel_go` and `bazel_gazelle` were in conflict; specifically, the `go_repository` rule was changed in a breaking fashion and our version of the Gazelle plugin didn't know about the change.

Because I needed specifically a Linux binary to bundle into the Sandbox container, I ended up just using the pre-compiled version from its releases (which I wish I'd thought of sooner).

I left it in because it fixes an issue. 🤷‍♀
